reviews.review_msg: Ulrich is a great professor, this class was my favourite this semester! The negotiation activities are really fun, and since the class size was small, you get to know everyone. Weekly quizzes are fairly easy, just review the chapter before, and you will be fine. He's very approachable and accommodating.

Had a great semester with Ulrich. Would recommend this class to anyone looking for extra credits. Lectures were interesting and group discussions were engaging. Expect to do some reading for weekly quizzes, but the written assignments were not too difficult.

There is quite a bit of work in this class - dont forget about the quizzes due every week. Reflective of the real world, you might have to negotiate with peers you do not see eye to eye with. Participate, participate, and participate... to add value to the experience. Mitra has plenty of experience, so go to her office hours to get to know her.

Mitra replies quick to emails. Lectures are used to listen to her talk about real life negotiations and practices. Tests and quizzes are based off textbooks. Lots of little assignments in this course that adds up to your grade.

Mitra is the worst prof I have ever had at SFU. She does not teach a single aspect of the course and expects you to read the textbook. All of her assignments are graded so biased and she grades on favouritism whether she likes you or not. VERY a little instruction for her assignments and unclear marking rubric. Avoid her at all costs!!!

Mitra is very disorganized and most class time is spent waiting for her. Assignment instructions are confusing. The final exam required reading each chapter of the textbook despite her not teaching the material in class. Stay away from this class.

Each week you have to read 1-2 chapters at home and compete weekly quizzes. Mitra does not teach in class and expects you to learn everything at home. Grades depend on peers, as everything is peer marked. Mitra does not debrief the cases so you are not prepared when you negotiate with professionals at the end of the term.

Mitra is one of the worst profs at SFU. She is rude and condescending. Class is mandatory, but has nothing to do with the final exam. All assignments are graded by your peers so your mark depends on how nice students are. Assignment instructions are unclear. She gives weekly quizzes for textbook chapters but does not teach the material in class.

Mitra is a very experienced professor in her field. Definitely take this class. The exam is easy. There are 2 mock interviews/negotiations that you do. The reading is heavy for the first half of the semester and then you won't have much. This is a great add-on if you're taking a heavy course load.

I loved her! Her class was structured well, plus she gave you a week before the midterm off to study for it! She was always available for help. The class is a little content heavy before the midterm but the workload decreases.
A tough grader and , if you have any other choices, please choose others to instead

He was not only a great teacher but also a great instructor who you can rely on. His lectures were full of fun, to be honest. He was giving real-life examples to which you can relate. Great way to learn! Wish every other teacher was like him too. We never lost touch with him. It is an honour to meet such a man!

So knowledgeable & makes everything so easy to understand. He used to make lectures soo fun by making us watch small clips from famous movies so we can remember them. His class was always interactive and he really cared about every student and tried his best to get them through the course. Amazing teacher who truly cared for every student.
His dedication is undeniable! The class is a mixture of fun, learning, and coaching. Beyond studies, I learned many things about how to cope with life. Definitely one of a kind learning experience.

I am surprised to see negative comments about him; his dedication to his job is exceptional. He is a firm believer in fundamental values. I took his class at Langara college and asked him some tough questions. His style is more coaching-oriented, and I think students need to respect the fact they are there to learn, not just to enjoy the routine.

I took two courses with Melissa and she is easily one of the best professors at SFU. Her classes are interesting, the grading criteria are fair and the workload is not overwhelming. Highly suggest anyone take BUS483 or 485 with her whether or not you are concentrating in HR

Melissa is the best prof at beedie. She is clear in her grading and is very caring. This was a 400-level course but the easiest Class I have done at Beedie. Definitely recommend taking a class with this prof!
